content.raw:
You're welcome! I really like Gazebo but this was crashing my research project, so the pleasure's all mine ;). I added a patch to #821.

By the way, since I might be making more changes, what do you use to develop Gazebo? I'm currently browsing the code in Eclipse but I somehow can't build it there, so in addition I'm using QtCreator on a different copy for building and debugging, which is far from ideal. Also, do you know of a good way to trick CMake of another project into using the locally compiled copy of Gazebo rather than what is installed through apt-get? I still have related weird stuff I'd like to investigate happening with plugins I'm writing for that project, but if they link to the system version without this patch I can't.
